body.body: Lubricate each gear and bush with clean engine oil during assembly.
Examine all gears, bearings and sleeves for damage, chipped teeth and wear beyond the service limits. Replace all suspect components and always use new circlips to assemble the shaft.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view

When using a press, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break-up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing, which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injury to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.
Place the input shaft bearing (13) on press bars ensuring the inner race of the bearing is supported by the bars and the circlip groove is pointing upwards.

Position the input shaft (12) to the bearing with the clutch end pointing downwards through the bearing. Press the input shaft (12) through the bearing until the bearing comes into contact with the fixed gear on the shaft.
Pressing On the Input Shaft Bearing
Ensure the fifth gear bush (16) is fitted such that the oil holes are closest to the shoulder of the input shaft.
Assemble the fifth gear bush (16) to the input shaft.
Fit fifth gear (11) to the bush and the input shaft with the dog teeth pointing away from the input shaft bearing.
Fit a new circlip (9) to the input shaft ensuring that it is located in the circlip groove.
Fit the combined third/fourth gear (8) with the larger gear facing towards fifth gear. Ensure that the oil hole in the input shaft DOES NOT align with the oil hole in the gear.
If the oil hole in the third/fourth gear is aligned with the corresponding hole in the input shaft, engine oil pressure and gear lubrication will be reduced.
Reduced oil pressure and gear lubrication will cause engine damage leading to engine seizure, resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit a new circlip (7) to the input shaft ensuring that the circlip (9) is located in the circlip groove.
Fit the thrust washer (6) to the input shaft (12) and slide up the shaft until in contact with the circlip (9).
Fit the splined bush (5) from sixth gear (4) ensuring that the oil hole in the shaft DOES NOT align with the hole in the bush.
Fit sixth gear (4) with the dog teeth facing third/fourth gear (8).
Place the second gear (3) on press bars with the stepped side facing down.
Position the input shaft (12) to the second gear (3). Press the input shaft through the second gear until the second gear comes into contact with the sixth gear (4).
Slide on the needle roller bearing (2).
Fit the bearing sleeve (1) to the needle roller bearing.
